11122.content:
It is just another normal Wednesday:

I am avenging somewhere in America. I am just a normal guy, recently turned 18 and this will be my last season and year at school, before I can start my internship at a big consulting company in New York. I got my contract already and the only prerequisite is to pass the final exams of my school. This is ahead of me the next couple of weeks. Until end of February there will be last exams and officially I will be release from school by end of March. So my first day in my job life will be 1 of April, sounds like a joke but it is true. I also have option to rent a small apartment somewhere in NYC, really looking forward to this.
My name is Frank Rahman and my Dad is an inventor and physicist working at SCIENCECO. This is some local company here at our small town, working for governments and according to my Dad everything is top secret and he never ever tells something about his work. Indeed nobody really seems to know what is going on in this company. My mother and me stopped asking, maybe it is also because he brings home a lot of money every month and we have a well suited life. We have a house, we have 3 cars and much more. Sometimes I feel bad about being such ridicules rich compared to others inside and outside the US.

So now another day in paradise starts for me and I went into the shower, get dressed into my designer jeans and short and after a short breakfast with my parents I used my car to go to school, where I was already expected by….

Nausicaas Diary
6/19/09

This is my first entry. You will know me as Nausicaa the Ghost, the avenging angel of America. I am writing this for posterity, but it will not be known to anyone except myself until my forseeable death, or until an otherwise unknown reason to reveal my true identity occurs. My real name is Frank Jahnke. I am an inventor and physicist working at SCIENCECO. You might know us for the company that finally gave the world feasible commercial jetpacks and intersteller travel. We cured global warming and solved the oil crisis with cold fusion. Of course that didn't make certain people very happy. There were attempts to reign us in, and my father got caught in some crossfire when some bloke motherfucker tried to kill me, I had to go into hiding. I used my talent to build a morphing remote. 1112321.content:
Or at least, he'd scanned the body during his experiments. Frank was in the body of his secretary, a candidate picked as much for her looks as her skills. Frank, sat patiently in the meeting room, with Nick and Debra, as the three of them discussed the future.

Frank was eager to continue her research, the soon she kept on working the sooner she could be restored. Debra assured the new Frank that getting rid of Jess Jackson was the first step.

It was an easy one to carry out, as Jess was lazy and relied on her charm, and charms to get away with her work. The real Jess was escorted from the building with a swiftness, and discreetness that allowed Frank to assume her position. For appearances' sake, she would have to be addressed as Jess, and only the three friends were trusted with the truth.

Frank scowled at her bust, the hiring of JJ more a joke than anything. His thoughts that JJ weren't just her initials, but also her bust size. The joke was a lot less funny, from this side, the weight pulling at her shoulders, the pain in her lower back not funny in the least.

Her brown-red hair catching the periphery of her vision too often. Walking through the lobby, she caught her reflection in the burnished bronze wall.

https://78.media.tumblr.com/7df785ea3fa6...

The key allowing the elevator to take her up to the lab... and Jess' desk. But, for all the familiarity, this short walk felt almost alien. In place, of the friendly smiles, and nods at his passing, she heard muttered whispers from the other secretaries, and lewd, unsettling glances from her male colleagues.

Her return to work, after a week of intensive coaching from Debra, an education that was frank, graphic and humiliating. Her wardrobe replaced, and a maid hired at company expense to allow her make-up and clothing selections to look right. The maid was told a story of Jess', as a pampered daughter of an executive, a spoiled child being groomed for a role in the company she hadn't earned. Jess had initially bristled at the role outlined for her, the cover story for the maid leaving her fuming. But Debra and Nick assured her, it would provide an excuse for the maid to never visit, or contact the company.

Entering the elevator, she watched with relief as the doors closed behind her, shutting her off from all the faces. She released the deep breath she hadn't realised she'd been holding.

As the elevator rose, Jess felt like a diver surfacing, the pressure or public scrutiny easing, and the thoughts of her lab bringing a sense of calm and order to her life, a sense of control. The elevator slowed, and with a -ping-, the doors opened.
1112321.title: He picked this body to be in.

choices: "We have to start slowly, Frank." she whispers back.
"Ah... yes. Jess, today, we're easing you in as a general typist."
"Well, since Frank's not here, you'll serve Nick Morgan today." she explained.
"You have to work on your cover first, and then the lab work!"
11123211.content:
"I'm eager to get back to work, Debra." you tell her, as you step out of the elevator. "After that bug." you tack the excuse for your absence on as you see movement from the corner of your eye. A well-filled skirt bend over a desk, shimmying vigorously from side to side, as she polishes the expansive oak surface.

"Good to see your enthusiasm, JJ." With a tilt of her head, she indicates the nearby cleaner. You need to keep up the pretence that you are Jess Jackson. "Oh, and I think we'll stick to formalities... for the moment."

"Sorry, Ms. Conway." you bob a curtsy, trickier in your tight skirt. Your bust bobbling in the cups of your bra, at the movement.

"Well, as you can see Jess. Mr. Jahnke isn't in today. So you won't have much to do."

Guiding you to the desk outside your lab, she slides you the access card across the table. Your broad beaming smile from the card, and the title secretary, underneath. Beneath that, a bar code for opening the doors, and your security clearance. You read the clearance with horror. It's level F... F as in Fuck All.

The security, is top of the line. Impossible to pass without the right checks.

Leaning forward, to hiss, "This is too low. I can't get in my lab with this..." Your rasping whisper, doesn't affect Debra, as much as you'd like. But she shoots you another cautionary glance, her eyes darting back to the girl who's now emptying the bins.
11123211.title: Debra is there to meet her.

111232112.content:
Guiding you back to the elevator, Debra presses for the fifteenth floor.

"You'll serve in the secretarial pool, today, Frank." Your true name only coming to her lips once the door slide shut.

She softly, squeezes your hand, in reassurance.

"But I'm not a good secretary." your voice sounding whiny to your ears, in the confines.

"Jess. You never were a good secretary." Her eyes fixed on your bust, as she spoke. "Men are such simple creatures, pleased by the simplest of things. The jiggle of lumps of awkward fleshy fat."

Self-consciously you want to cover your bust, to rail against her insult. Both as Jess, and as Frank. But your words are smoothed away, as she caresses your cheek.

"Don't pout so." she gently chides, "That works best on ... only on men. To another woman, it merely looks childish and petulant."

You nod your understanding, not trusting your voice as you feel a surge of emotions. This body feels so much more volatile, so many more emotions, and hormones to balance.

"It'll be a quiet morning, for you. I've arranged for Nick to need a secretary at 10:00. He'll ensure you're out of the way, and not overly taxed."

Glancing at your watch, you see it's barely past 9:05.

Jumping ahead, of your question.

"Just relax and have a coffee until you're needed. Don't worry, all the other secretaries, and bosses don't want a busty bimbo to mess up their work. Besides, Frank's name will give you some protection."

Again, you feel the sting of her insults, her dismissal of you as a dummy.

The elevator pings, and the doors slide open.

"Here you go, Miss Jackson. Wait here until... if you're needed."

You mouth some words to her, as the doors close behind you, leaving you alone, as your ally heads back to her work. Slowly turning around, you see the other secretaries looking you over. Their judgements just as harsh, just as blatant, just as dismissive as Debra's own.
